name: places/ChIJ7XT1qwf0wokRDEN1SMw2OBA
formattedAddress: 70 Sherman Ave, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 70 Sherman Ave, New York, NY 10040-1029, USA

originalText.text:
I'm sad to have to update this review on 10/18 after they recently destroyed a favorite shirt and a favorite pair of pants two weeks in a row. Both were covered with bleach stains after they laundered them.

I would still take my dry cleaning to them and alterations, although they screwed up one of those as well recently.  Regular laundry I now take somewhere else.

I hate to give them a bad review, but as much as I love the owner, she has real difficulty accepting responsibility for her mistakes. That's a real problem and it's maddening when the the issue is clearly the fault of the cleaners. Use at your own risk.

They are efficient and friendly. I have sensitive skin, so they work with me on using non-allergenic products.

I also go to them for all of my alterations - they are very skilled with that. They took a beat up winter coat and gave it new life. If I have any stubborn stains they charge five bucks for an extra cleaning treatment.  Well worth the money to save my favorite shirts and pants. Highly recommend.

originalText.text:
I have been using Five Star Cleaners for the last 6 + years since moving to the Dyckman Street area. I have found the business itself to be very efficient and communicative. They have prompt pick-up and delivery, are well-organized and answer the phone. I have never had a lost item, or any damage and I use them for both my laundry and dry cleaning.

The owner, Ms. Vicky almost always answers the phone and is very pleasant and professional. When she is not able to answer the phone, one of her staff does and they are equally pleasant and professional. She is also good for small fabric repairs and minor mending. If there is a tailoring job she is not confident about, she will tell you honestly.

Overall, I really like this store and will continue to do business with them until I leave the neighborhood.

originalText.text:
UPDATE Oct 2022:  CONTINUED EMPHATIC AVOID,  SUBSTANDARD SERVICE FOR FULL PRICE.
After avoiding 5 Star Cleaners since they messed up my tux alterations three years ago, I had a large load of dry cleaning at the end of this summer, and this is the closest place.  I thought I'd just make use of their dry-cleaning, not alterations.  So, I dropped off a couple summer suits and a couple of jackets for dry-cleaning and winterization. Everywhere else I've had suits "winterized", that meant they dry clean the suit, and add extra padding on the hanger in the shoulders, and possibly an extra bag -- some way of slightly better preparing the suit for months of storage.  I just picked the suits and jackets up, and paying $18/suit, the going price in this neighborhood.  The suits were returned on bare wire hangers, with no paper and absolutely no padding in the shoulders -- neither winterized, nor even padded as much as usual from every other dry cleaner.  Full priced, substandard service.
2019: DO NOT TRUST THEM TO TAILOR anything but the simplest fixes, and not on fine garments.  Ok for dry cleaning, laundering. I've had some shirts laundered, and suits dry cleaned there on a few occasions, and simple repairs like fixing a whole in jeans, and hemming pants. Fine.  Then I brought in a quality tux for repair and alterations and specifically asked if they were confident they could handle this.  Of course, the manager/owner promised, and the tailor agreed.  What a disaster!  The pants were let out and the front zipper was all askew. The seams on the jacket were rough. The nape of the jacket neck had needed repair, and not only was the repair looking very rough, the collar wouldn't even cover its own lining! The tailor hadn't figured for that?!  When I pointed out the lining of the collar was exposed in the back at the nape of the neck, the tailor, speaking virtually no English, showed me other garbagy garments and shoddily repaired jackets, saying: look, that's common, everyone wears it like that.  ?!?!  I'm the grandson of a tailor who made suits from scratch, and know what I'm talking about.  I pointed out no jacket should be worn looking like that!  I'm going to have to have at least half the work redone by a competent tailor. Nonetheless, the owner refused to acknowledge my complaints, that I had any cause for complaint, and demanded I pay $84 of the original $90 charge for a suit that's unwearable!!  BEWARE: WHEN THEY RUIN YOUR STUFF, YOU'RE OUT OF LUCK, so bring only basics for basic cleaning.

originalText.text: I used their laundry pickup service and discovered after a few weeks that they were falsely reporting the weight of my laundry. They charged me for 40 lb of laundry when the bag was only 30 lb. Hopefully this was an honest mistake, but they were not willing to fix the issue when I pointed it out, so I will have to go somewhere else.

text.text: I used their laundry pickup service and discovered after a few weeks that they were falsely reporting the weight of my laundry. They charged me for 40 lb of laundry when the bag was only 30 lb. Hopefully this was an honest mistake, but they were not willing to fix the issue when I pointed it out, so I will have to go somewhere else.

originalText.text: I ALWAYS go to them and I live downtown. I feel safe and my clothing alterations are superb! I mean my clothes fit me like a Barbie doll after! :-)
